item.title: About
item.description: I am a PhD student at UC Berkeley in Environmental Science, Policy and Management studying fire ecology using remote sensing. I am co-advised by Dr. Van Butsic, who studies Land Use Change, and Dr. Scott Stephens, who works on wildland fire. I am interested in Improved Forest Management carbon offsets in California’s cap-and-trade market and questions of environmental justice in wildfire recovery. I have a Bachelor’s of Science from UC Berkeley, where I majored in Conservation and Resource Studies and Society and Environment and minored in Forestry, Public Policy, and Geospatial Information Systems.

item.title: Articles
item.description: Articles I have worked on This page has links to blogs

item.title: GIS Labs
item.description: Intro to GIS labs 1. Digitizing and Digital Elevation Models This lab was developed using Google Earth Pro (free!) and Arc Map. I am looking forward to adapting this to include Arc Pro and R functions. 2. Raster Math functions and Sea Level Rise This lab looks at different senarios of Sea Level Rise impact land cover in the San Francisco Bay.
